title: Energy conservation vs Energy efficiency
summary: Guide explaining the difference between energy efficiency (technological improvements) and energy conservation (behavioral/operational changes), with focus on building optimization strategies and predictive control systems.

key_concepts.energy_efficiency: Replacing equipment with more efficient alternatives (e.g., LED lightbulbs)
key_concepts.energy_conservation: Reducing energy use through behavioral changes (e.g., turning off lights)
key_concepts.predictive_control: Software that anticipates conditions and adjusts equipment operation in advance

main_problems: Modern buildings are efficient but wasteful (e.g., overcooling malls)
Difficulty measuring conservation progress due to external factors
Government incentives favor efficiency over conservation
Tendency to replace rather than optimize existing equipment
conservation_strategies: Education & change of habits (closing windows during heating)

measurement_challenges.issue: Hard to quantify conservation when external factors (like COVID) affect consumption
measurement_challenges.solution: Internationally recognized standards for building reference baselines

equipment_lifecycle.problem: Replacing after 5 years for newer models is unsustainable

key_insight: Even the most modern and efficient facilities have room for improvement through proper energy conservation strategies

author.description: Provider of remote operation & maintenance services (O&M) for heating-cooling systems (HVAC-R) in commercial buildings and factories
